page.title: 13A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A
page.content: A day in the life of a farmer-late summer. Get up at 5.45am to collect cows from fields to take to milking parlour to milk them. Around here they are milked by milking machine-very few milked by hand. At 6.30am he feeds milk to the young calves and for the older calves-concentrates. At 6.40 milk the goats then feed the hens. At 8am have breakfast. At 8.30am they put the cows back in the field. Next they feed the goat kids. At 8.40am the children are taken to school. At 9.05 when they come back some friends come to help with the bailing. The farmer goes round the field of cut dried grass and bails it. Some of the friends to back to the farm to collect another tractor and trailer. They go back to the farmer and collect the bales of hay and stack them onto the trailer and go back to the farm/cont.,
